H0.text: who grows the most coffee in the world. Colombia

H1.text: who grows the most coffee in the world. Ethiopia

H2.text: who grows the most coffee in the world. Vietnam

H3.text: who grows the most coffee in the world. Brazil

A4.text: In most coffee-growing countries, there is one major harvest a year; though in countries like Colombia, where there are two flowerings a year, there is a main and secondary crop, the main one April to June and a smaller one in November to December.

A5.text: In most countries, the coffee crop is picked by hand, a labor-intensive and difficult process, though in places like Brazil, where the landscape is relatively flat and the coffee fields are immense, the process has been mechanized.

A6.text: Brazil has been the world's largest producer of coffee for the last 150 years, currently producing about a third of all coffee.

A7.text: In 2011 Brazil was the world leader in production of green coffee, followed by Vietnam, Indonesia and Colombia.
